title.narrative: INTERFACE BASIC SOCIAL SERVICES AND SP

description.narrative: Populations are informed on the situation of children rights especially the most disadvantaged and basic social services

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
Shock responsive social protection - Strengthening social protection system for humanitarian response (preparedness)
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Social welfare workforce strengthening - Case management, referral, capacity development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Populations are informed on the situation of children rights especially the most disadvantaged and basic social services

description.narrative: UNICEF carried out an analysis of child poverty, covering monetary and multidimensional aspects. The analysis showed that 42% of children live in monetary poverty and 60% face multidimensional poverty. It also showed that almost one child out of four among those living in poor households from a monetary point of view (10% out of 42%) are not poor at the multidimensional level. In contrast, almost half (29% of 60%) of multidimensional poor children live in households that are not poor in monetary terms. The publication of these results has strengthened knowledge of children's situation in the Comoros among the population. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/01/2020
